docs.lead_paragraph: One evening during my residency, I found a friend, another doctor in training, standing at the foot of his patient's bed in the intensive care unit, shaking his head. The middle-aged patient was well known to many doctors and nurses in the hospital. Unemployed and living in one of the city's rougher neighborhoods, he appeared regularly in the emergency room with his blood sugars way out of control.

headline.main: When Doctor's Advice Is Ignored at Home

docs.abstract: For many patients, evidence-based medicine isn't working.
